match.title: 2nd ODI
match.statusText: Sri Lanka won by 17 runs (D/L method)

series.name: South Africa tour of Sri Lanka
series.longName: South Africa tour of Sri Lanka

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Chandimal c du Plessis b Morkel 43 (51b 4x4 0x6 85m) SR: 84.31

dismissalComment.html: more sensational fielding from South Africa, a diving two-handed catch at backward point ends Chandimal's stay, that was short and wide, Chandimal really got hold of that, lacing it towards backward point, not good enough to get it past du Plessis, though, he's one of the best fielders in the world, and he just showed why he's rated that highly, ends a good innings from Chandimal, not easy scoring on this surface

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c †de Villiers b Morkel 43 (64b 1x4 0x6 124m) SR: 67.18

dismissalComment.html: superb diving catch from AB de Villiers, Morkel has removed the last of the big three, no feet as usual from Dilshan as he went after a wide delivery, nicks it through, de Villiers flies to his right to pouch that one and end a scratchy innings from Dilshan, Sri Lanka in trouble now with two new batsmen in the middle

a spectacular catch gets the first wicket, a short ball from Morkel, Tharanga is hurried into the pull, doesn't time the ball at all, it loops towards midwicket where Peterson runs back and dives to send back Tharanga for another low score

superb diving catch from AB de Villiers, Morkel has removed the last of the big three, no feet as usual from Dilshan as he went after a wide delivery, nicks it through, de Villiers flies to his right to pouch that one and end a scratchy innings from Dilshan, Sri Lanka in trouble now with two new batsmen in the middle

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: more sensational fielding from South Africa, a diving two-handed catch at backward point ends Chandimal's stay, that was short and wide, Chandimal really got hold of that, lacing it towards backward point, not good enough to get it past du Plessis, though, he's one of the best fielders in the world, and he just showed why he's rated that highly, ends a good innings from Chandimal, not easy scoring on this surface

headshotImage.caption: Jehan Mubarak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jehan Mubarak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: and another wicket, Mubarak the man to go now, Duminy sends a flat delivery heading for leg stump, Mubarak chips it back to the bowler, pretty soft dismissal that

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga c Peterson b Morkel 3 (14b 0x4 0x6 13m) SR: 21.42

dismissalComment.html: a spectacular catch gets the first wicket, a short ball from Morkel, Tharanga is hurried into the pull, doesn't time the ball at all, it loops towards midwicket where Peterson runs back and dives to send back Tharanga for another low score

headshotImage.caption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Petersen b Phangiso 37 (60b 6x4 0x6 63m) SR: 61.66

dismissalComment.html: Phangiso's decision to keep flighting the ball pays off, once again Sangakkara skips down the track but the ball is too wide for him to properly control it, he whacks it anyway but can't clear extra cover, a rare unwise stroke from Sangakkara, and South Africa have got a huge wicket here

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene b Peterson 17 (29b 1x4 0x6 30m) SR: 58.62

dismissalComment.html: once again Mahela goes for the reverse-sweep, he misses and that flighted ball goes between his legs to crashes into the stumps, Peterson is elated, another big strike for South Africa, Sri Lanka in a bit of bother here

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c †de Villiers b Morkel 43 (64b 1x4 0x6 124m) SR: 67.18

dismissalComment.html: superb diving catch from AB de Villiers, Morkel has removed the last of the big three, no feet as usual from Dilshan as he went after a wide delivery, nicks it through, de Villiers flies to his right to pouch that one and end a scratchy innings from Dilshan, Sri Lanka in trouble now with two new batsmen in the middle

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Lahiru Thirimanne lbw b McLaren 13 (27b 0x4 0x6 40m) SR: 48.14

dismissalComment.html: Has he struck first ball? he fires in a full ball that strikes Thirimanne just above the ankle on the back leg after pitching, umpire says that's out, Thirimanne immediately asks for the review, given how quickly he asked for the replay, he must have thought he nicked it, there's no Hot Spot here though, some doubt over whether that would have missed the leg stump as well, but the replay says 'umpire's call' and Thirimanne has to go

headshotImage.longCaption: Jehan Mubarak player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.longCaption: Jehan Mubarak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Jehan Mubarak c & b Duminy 8 (15b 1x4 0x6 26m) SR: 53.33

dismissalComment.html: and another wicket, Mubarak the man to go now, Duminy sends a flat delivery heading for leg stump, Mubarak chips it back to the bowler, pretty soft dismissal that

headshotImage.caption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Colin Ingram player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Colin Ingram player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Thisara Perera c sub (CA Ingram) b Morris 11 (14b 1x4 0x6 17m) SR: 78.57

dismissalComment.html: Perera's chancy stay is over, a short of length ball from Morris, Perera looks to flat bat it out of the park, toe ends it to mid-off, simple catch this time, no one is dropping that, Perera is on his way

dismissalComment.html: more sensational fielding from South Africa, a diving two-handed catch at backward point ends Chandimal's stay, that was short and wide, Chandimal really got hold of that, lacing it towards backward point, not good enough to get it past du Plessis, though, he's one of the best fielders in the world, and he just showed why he's rated that highly, ends a good innings from Chandimal, not easy scoring on this surface

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rangana Herath run out (Morkel/†de Villiers) 13 (16b 1x4 0x6 27m) SR: 81.25

dismissalComment.html: a low full toss on legstump, Herath backs away and slices that behind backward point, he wants the second and he sprints back but the throw from the deep is perfect, flat and just above the bails, de Villiers completes the run-out

headshotImage.caption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Alviro Petersen lbw b Herath 24 (28b 4x4 0x6 47m) SR: 85.71

dismissalComment.html: in his first over, Herath has struck, that looked plumb, Petersen was looking to work the ball to the leg side, it doesn't turn as he expects, goes straight on and he misses it, he is struck low on the pads, that pitched just outside off, struck in front of middle, going on to hit leg, he referred it as well, but to no use, only doubt was whether it was going on to hit, it says 'umpire's call', bye bye Petersen

dismissalText.commentary: David Miller not out 22 (34b 1x4 0x6 31m) SR: 64.7

headshotImage.caption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: in his first over, Herath has struck, that looked plumb, Petersen was looking to work the ball to the leg side, it doesn't turn as he expects, goes straight on and he misses it, he is struck low on the pads, that pitched just outside off, struck in front of middle, going on to hit leg, he referred it as well, but to no use, only doubt was whether it was going on to hit, it says 'umpire's call', bye bye Petersen

lovely delivery to get your 50th ODI wicket, Herath tosses it up outside off, sucks him into the drive, has to play at that really, it was close to off stump, spun away to take the edge through to Sanga, who goes up immediately

a huge lbw appeal, de Villiers looking to sweep, he misses and is struck on the pads, will they review it? a discussion between Dilshan, Sangakkara and another fielder, they are taking a long time to decide, they have referred it, that pitched just outside off, the doubt was over whether he was struck in line as well, the replays show that he was, and the ball was going on to hit the middle stump, de Villiers is gone, and is that the game as well?

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Robin Peterson b Malinga 3 (3b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: this one is not sliding down leg, it is headed for the base of middle stump and is far too good for Robin, no footwork as he tries to negotiate that curling thunderbolt from Malinga, doesn't get bat on it and that crashes into the stumps, Malinga does it again

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy c †Sangakkara b Perera 15 (17b 2x4 0x6 27m) SR: 88.23

dismissalComment.html: Perera gets the breakthrough, he's a wicket-taker this guy, pitching it short of length around off, the ball snakes away just a touch, good bounce there as well, Duminy can only feather it through to the keeper

headshotImage.caption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Alviro Petersen lbw b Herath 24 (28b 4x4 0x6 47m) SR: 85.71

dismissalComment.html: in his first over, Herath has struck, that looked plumb, Petersen was looking to work the ball to the leg side, it doesn't turn as he expects, goes straight on and he misses it, he is struck low on the pads, that pitched just outside off, struck in front of middle, going on to hit leg, he referred it as well, but to no use, only doubt was whether it was going on to hit, it says 'umpire's call', bye bye Petersen

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers lbw b Dilshan 12 (18b 1x4 0x6 27m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: a huge lbw appeal, de Villiers looking to sweep, he misses and is struck on the pads, will they review it? a discussion between Dilshan, Sangakkara and another fielder, they are taking a long time to decide, they have referred it, that pitched just outside off, the doubt was over whether he was struck in line as well, the replays show that he was, and the ball was going on to hit the middle stump, de Villiers is gone, and is that the game as well?

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis c †Sangakkara b Herath 8 (9b 1x4 0x6 16m) SR: 88.88

dismissalComment.html: lovely delivery to get your 50th ODI wicket, Herath tosses it up outside off, sucks him into the drive, has to play at that really, it was close to off stump, spun away to take the edge through to Sanga, who goes up immediately

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

batsmen.shot: off side drive on front foot

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: looks to carve that through the off side, it was the standard Perera delivery, back of length and just outside off, he misses

commentPostTextItems.html: 11.10pm It's over. Called off. Sri Lanka win by 17 runs. It would have been a tough chase for South Africa even if it was a full 50-over chase. With Amla unavailable due to injury, it became even tougher.
Man of the Match today should be the groundstaff who have put in some serious hard work today.
The Man of the Match is Dinesh Chandimal, for his battling 43.

AB de Villiers: "Much better game from us, the bowling did okay, the batsmen let us down, very disappointing. It's not over yet, three big games coming up for us now. Amla is injured, not too serious, hopefully we'll get him ready for the next match. He was scheduled to come out to bat after the next wicket fell. I think we have the potential and the talent in the batting unit." He says the much-improved fielding was one of the positives today.

Dinesh Chandimal: "When I went to bat, we were four down, I just assessed the pitch and then played my normal game. We played on the same pitch before, that's why I opted to bat first. Angelo will come in for the next game, we have our fingers crossed for winning the game."

That's a wrap of our coverage for now, Firdose Moonda's match report is being updated here, and Andrew Fernando will have more analysis later on. Thanks again for all the thoughts on subsitutes, DRS and everything else. See you on the 26th for the third ODI.
11.00pm Andrew Fernando's latest: "All the covers are coming on, chances of further play are slim, just in terms of how long it would take to peel them off again."

jee1: ""The D/L method,which is used to calculate par scores in rain affected matches , sets a higher score while reducing the overs for side batting side , by saying that second batting side will have clear idea of how many overs they play , unlike the side batting first..But why does it not take into consideration , the pitch conditions and the outfield after it rains??It becomes difficult for side batting side to play on a damp pitch,giving advantage to the bowling side..""

AP: "@Jee1, while the batting conditions do change on account of a wet outfield and damper pitch, the bowling/fielding conditions also change on account a wetter ball which is more difficult to grip for both spinners and fast bowlers. Fielding is also trickier with fielders slipping around and bounce on the outfield is lot less uniform. It is usually assumed that the negative changes to batting are evened out with the negative changed to bowling/fielding. Hence those factors are neglected."

Ben: "jee 1 is bang on with the pitch condition. I have always sided with D/L just because there is no better alternative at this time. However, D/L is lacking in taking the pitch condition which in this case clearly favoured SL..."
10.49pm Rain stops play. The umpires took a bit of time discussing whether to stop play, but the rain is pretty steady now, which means the covers are coming out.
The cut-off time is 11.15pm, which means it is unlikely we are going to get more cricket today. Even if the rain stops soon, it will take a while for the covers to be take off and the outfield dried.
Par score at this stage is 121 for 5.
Elvis Joseph: "Rain came 2 overs late for South Africa!"

Tej: "There are better alternatives than the D/L method - but no one is prepared to listen. Just schedule the 50 over games with two days in mind including nights with lights. The public pays for two sets of 50 over and they should get their money's worth. It is as simple as that."

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: length ball on leg stump, McLaren shuffles across and plays a lap sweep, the sluggish outfield means McLaren won't get a boundary
Miller again looking to smash that towards midwicket, comes on quicker than he expects and he misses, the ball rolls towards backward point
length ball on leg stump, clipped towards midwicket for a single
looking to for the big hit once more, wanted to mow that over midwicket, inside-edges to the pads for a single

commentPreTextItems.html: Perera returns to the attack. Batting Powerplay taken

commentTextItems.html: Miller shows off his hitting ability, a flat-batted hit to a ball that was back of a length and outside off, easily clears mid-off and races away for four
on the pads, that is clipped to long leg for a single, superb over from Malinga

commentPostTextItems.html: Par score after 21 overs: 121 for 5, 127 for 6

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: a groan of frustration from Miller as he misses the ball again, five dot balls so far
looks to glide that one towards third man, he misses and that no runs yet in this over
drops it a touch short, on middle stump, driven towards cover
pitched up and outside off, driven towards cover

commentPreTextItems.html: The DL sheet is handed over to McLaren, who is giving it a close read, as he well should. It has started drizzling again, the ground staff are taking their place outside the boundary

commentTextItems.html: short of length ball on middle stump, defended towards the bowler
length ball turns in towards middle stump, defended down the track

commentPostTextItems.html: Par score after 20 overs: 117 for 5, 124 for 6

headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Jehan Mubarak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jehan Mubarak player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: spinning away after pitching outside off, slapped towards cover
lashed towards sweeper cover for a single
pushed towards mid-on this time
punched towards long-on for one more, South Africa not trying anything extravagant here
stays on the back foot and pushes the ball towards  long-on for one more
pitched up and well outside off, driven towards point where Malinga fields

dismissalComment.html: Has he struck first ball? he fires in a full ball that strikes Thirimanne just above the ankle on the back leg after pitching, umpire says that's out, Thirimanne immediately asks for the review, given how quickly he asked for the replay, he must have thought he nicked it, there's no Hot Spot here though, some doubt over whether that would have missed the leg stump as well, but the replay says 'umpire's call' and Thirimanne has to go

Phangiso's decision to keep flighting the ball pays off, once again Sangakkara skips down the track but the ball is too wide for him to properly control it, he whacks it anyway but can't clear extra cover, a rare unwise stroke from Sangakkara, and South Africa have got a huge wicket here

headshotImage.caption: Jehan Mubarak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jehan Mubarak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: and another wicket, Mubarak the man to go now, Duminy sends a flat delivery heading for leg stump, Mubarak chips it back to the bowler, pretty soft dismissal that

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Jehan Mubarak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jehan Mubarak player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Shaminda Eranga player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shaminda Eranga player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Shaminda Eranga player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shaminda Eranga player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga c Peterson b Morkel 3 (14b 0x4 0x6 13m) SR: 21.42

dismissalComment.html: a spectacular catch gets the first wicket, a short ball from Morkel, Tharanga is hurried into the pull, doesn't time the ball at all, it loops towards midwicket where Peterson runs back and dives to send back Tharanga for another low score

headshotImage.caption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Petersen b Phangiso 37 (60b 6x4 0x6 63m) SR: 61.66

dismissalComment.html: Phangiso's decision to keep flighting the ball pays off, once again Sangakkara skips down the track but the ball is too wide for him to properly control it, he whacks it anyway but can't clear extra cover, a rare unwise stroke from Sangakkara, and South Africa have got a huge wicket here

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene b Peterson 17 (29b 1x4 0x6 30m) SR: 58.62

dismissalComment.html: once again Mahela goes for the reverse-sweep, he misses and that flighted ball goes between his legs to crashes into the stumps, Peterson is elated, another big strike for South Africa, Sri Lanka in a bit of bother here

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c †de Villiers b Morkel 43 (64b 1x4 0x6 124m) SR: 67.18

dismissalComment.html: superb diving catch from AB de Villiers, Morkel has removed the last of the big three, no feet as usual from Dilshan as he went after a wide delivery, nicks it through, de Villiers flies to his right to pouch that one and end a scratchy innings from Dilshan, Sri Lanka in trouble now with two new batsmen in the middle

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Lahiru Thirimanne lbw b McLaren 13 (27b 0x4 0x6 40m) SR: 48.14

dismissalComment.html: Has he struck first ball? he fires in a full ball that strikes Thirimanne just above the ankle on the back leg after pitching, umpire says that's out, Thirimanne immediately asks for the review, given how quickly he asked for the replay, he must have thought he nicked it, there's no Hot Spot here though, some doubt over whether that would have missed the leg stump as well, but the replay says 'umpire's call' and Thirimanne has to go

headshotImage.caption: Jehan Mubarak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jehan Mubarak player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Jehan Mubarak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jehan Mubarak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Jehan Mubarak c & b Duminy 8 (15b 1x4 0x6 26m) SR: 53.33

dismissalComment.html: and another wicket, Mubarak the man to go now, Duminy sends a flat delivery heading for leg stump, Mubarak chips it back to the bowler, pretty soft dismissal that

headshotImage.caption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Colin Ingram player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Colin Ingram player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Thisara Perera c sub (CA Ingram) b Morris 11 (14b 1x4 0x6 17m) SR: 78.57

dismissalComment.html: Perera's chancy stay is over, a short of length ball from Morris, Perera looks to flat bat it out of the park, toe ends it to mid-off, simple catch this time, no one is dropping that, Perera is on his way

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Chandimal c du Plessis b Morkel 43 (51b 4x4 0x6 85m) SR: 84.31

dismissalComment.html: more sensational fielding from South Africa, a diving two-handed catch at backward point ends Chandimal's stay, that was short and wide, Chandimal really got hold of that, lacing it towards backward point, not good enough to get it past du Plessis, though, he's one of the best fielders in the world, and he just showed why he's rated that highly, ends a good innings from Chandimal, not easy scoring on this surface

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rangana Herath run out (Morkel/†de Villiers) 13 (16b 1x4 0x6 27m) SR: 81.25

dismissalComment.html: a low full toss on legstump, Herath backs away and slices that behind backward point, he wants the second and he sprints back but the throw from the deep is perfect, flat and just above the bails, de Villiers completes the run-out

headshotImage.caption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Alviro Petersen lbw b Herath 24 (28b 4x4 0x6 47m) SR: 85.71

dismissalComment.html: in his first over, Herath has struck, that looked plumb, Petersen was looking to work the ball to the leg side, it doesn't turn as he expects, goes straight on and he misses it, he is struck low on the pads, that pitched just outside off, struck in front of middle, going on to hit leg, he referred it as well, but to no use, only doubt was whether it was going on to hit, it says 'umpire's call', bye bye Petersen

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Robin Peterson b Malinga 3 (3b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: this one is not sliding down leg, it is headed for the base of middle stump and is far too good for Robin, no footwork as he tries to negotiate that curling thunderbolt from Malinga, doesn't get bat on it and that crashes into the stumps, Malinga does it again

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy c †Sangakkara b Perera 15 (17b 2x4 0x6 27m) SR: 88.23

dismissalComment.html: Perera gets the breakthrough, he's a wicket-taker this guy, pitching it short of length around off, the ball snakes away just a touch, good bounce there as well, Duminy can only feather it through to the keeper

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers lbw b Dilshan 12 (18b 1x4 0x6 27m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: a huge lbw appeal, de Villiers looking to sweep, he misses and is struck on the pads, will they review it? a discussion between Dilshan, Sangakkara and another fielder, they are taking a long time to decide, they have referred it, that pitched just outside off, the doubt was over whether he was struck in line as well, the replays show that he was, and the ball was going on to hit the middle stump, de Villiers is gone, and is that the game as well?

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis c †Sangakkara b Herath 8 (9b 1x4 0x6 16m) SR: 88.88

dismissalComment.html: lovely delivery to get your 50th ODI wicket, Herath tosses it up outside off, sucks him into the drive, has to play at that really, it was close to off stump, spun away to take the edge through to Sanga, who goes up immediately

dismissalText.commentary: David Miller not out 22 (34b 1x4 0x6 31m) SR: 64.7

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ryan McLaren not out 14 (17b 1x4 0x6 26m) SR: 82.35

headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021

notes: Sri Lanka innings
Wet Ground: Sri Lanka - 0/0
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 38 runs, 1 wicket)
Sri Lanka: 50 runs in 14.2 overs (86 balls), Extras 7
2nd Wicket: 50 runs in 70 balls (TM Dilshan 13, KC Sangakkara 32, Ex 5)
Drinks: Sri Lanka - 58/1 in 16.0 overs (TM Dilshan 16, KC Sangakkara 32)
Sri Lanka: 100 runs in 24.2 overs (146 balls), Extras 14
Drinks: Sri Lanka - 134/4 in 33.0 overs (HDRL Thirimanne 11, LD Chandimal 6)
Over 35.1: Review by Sri Lanka (Batting), Umpire - RSA Palliyaguruge, Batsman - HDRL Thirimanne (Struck down)
Powerplay 2: Overs 35.1 - 40.0 (Batting side - 24 runs, 1 wicket)
Sri Lanka: 150 runs in 37.2 overs (224 balls), Extras 19
Rain: Sri Lanka - 181/6 in 43.0 overs (LD Chandimal 37, NLTC Perera 3)
Sri Lanka: 200 runs in 45.5 overs (277 balls), Extras 23
Rain: Sri Lanka - 223/9 in 49.2 overs (RMS Eranga 7, SL Malinga 0)
Innings Break: Sri Lanka - 223/9 in 49.2 overs (RMS Eranga 7, SL Malinga 0)
South Africa innings
Rain: South Africa - 0/0
Reduced to 29 overs
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 6.0 (Mandatory - 39 runs, 1 wicket)
South Africa: 50 runs in 8.6 overs (54 balls), Extras 4
Over 9.4: Review by South Africa (Batting), Umpire - RR Wimalasiri, Batsman - AN Petersen (Struck down)
Over 12.1: Review by Sri Lanka (Bowling), Umpire - RSA Palliyaguruge, Batsman - AB de Villiers (Upheld)
South Africa: 100 runs in 20.2 overs (122 balls), Extras 5
Rain: South Africa - 104/5 in 21.0 overs (DA Miller 22, R McLaren 14)

milestones.description: Sangakkara has scored 90 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for SL breaking Jayasuriya's record

stories.title: Spin fast becoming the bane of SA's ODI game
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: Spin fast becoming the bane of South Africa's ODI game
stories.summary: As South Africa look to improve a dismal record in Sri Lanka, their spinners will have to rethink their strategy and find better ways to utilise the helpful conditions

image.caption: Aaron Phangiso appeals unsuccessfully
image.longCaption: Aaron Phangiso appeals unsuccessfully, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 1st ODI, Colombo, July 20, 2013

stories.title: Injured Amla in doubt for third ODI
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: Injured Hashim Amla in doubt for third ODI
stories.summary: Hashim Amla is in severe doubt for the third ODI against Sri Lanka after sustaining a grade one tear to his left groin muscle while fielding during Sri Lanka's innings

image.caption: Hashim Amla leaves the field after suffering an injury
image.longCaption: Hashim Amla leaves the field after suffering an injury, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Colombo, July 23, 2013

stories.byline: Andrew Fidel Fernando at the R Premadasa

image.longCaption: Mahela Jayawardene was bowled by Robin Peterson, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Colombo, July 23, 2013

stories.title: Sri Lanka 2-0 up after rainy day
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: Sri Lanka 2-0 up after rainy day
stories.summary: A second, successive sub-standard performance with the bat saw South Africa undo their significantly improved showing with the ball to go 2-0 down in the series

image.caption: Dinesh Chandimal plays a lofted shot
image.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal plays a lofted shot, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Colombo, July 23, 2013

stories.title: SA to stick with two specialist spinners
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: South Africa to stick with two specialist spinners
stories.summary: South Africa's bowlers were largely to blame for the loss in the first ODI, but AB de Villiers was particularly enamoured of the prospect of fielding two frontline spinners

image.caption: Aaron Phangiso is congratulated after dismissing Kumar Sangakkara
image.longCaption: Aaron Phangiso is congratulated after dismissing Kumar Sangakkara, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 1st ODI, Colombo, July 20, 2013

stories.title: Chandimal focuses on adaptability
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa: Chandimal focuses on adaptability
stories.summary: With Sri Lanka's seniors still going strong, Dinesh Chandimal will have to get used to batting lower down for some time. He wants the youngsters, including himself, to start contributing more if a crisis hits

image.caption: Dinesh Chandimal is all smiles after his side's win
image.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal is all smiles after his side's win, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 1st ODI, Colombo, July 20, 2013
